biography:
65daysofstatic (also known by the abbreviations 65dos, 65days, or simply 65) are an instrumental post-rock and math rock band from Sheffield, England comprising Paul Wolinski, Joe Shrewsbury, Rob Jones and Simon Wright. The band has released five studio albums: The Fall of Math, One Time for All Time, The Destruction of Small Ideas, We Were Exploding Anyway, and Silent Running.

Initially, the band interspersed heavy, progressive, guitar-driven instrumental sections with live drums and off-beat sampled drums akin to those of Aphex Twin, although since their second album they have developed their work to include keyboard parts.
name: 65daysofstatic

discogs.name: 65daysofstatic
discogs.profile: Sheffield (UK) based math/post rock band founded in 2001 by Joe Shrewsbury (also known as [a=JoeFro]), [a=Paul Wolinski] and [a=Iain Armstrong]. In May 2003 [a=Iain Armstrong] left the band. [a=Graham Clarke] (also known as [a=Feedle]) joined for a short moment in 2003 and in the end of 2003 [a=Rob Jones (2)] and [a=Gareth Hughes] joined the band. Around September 2004 [a=Gareth Hughes] left the band again and [a=Simon Wright (3)] took over.

raw_data.name: 65daysofstatic
raw_data.profile: Sheffield (UK) based math/post rock band founded in 2001 by Joe Shrewsbury (also known as [a=JoeFro]), [a=Paul Wolinski] and [a=Iain Armstrong]. In May 2003 [a=Iain Armstrong] left the band. [a=Graham Clarke] (also known as [a=Feedle]) joined for a short moment in 2003 and in the end of 2003 [a=Rob Jones (2)] and [a=Gareth Hughes] joined the band. Around September 2004 [a=Gareth Hughes] left the band again and [a=Simon Wright (3)] took over.

raw_data.lastfm: ArtistLastFmData(name='65daysofstatic', url='https://www.last.fm/music/65daysofstatic', mbid='0cd12ab3-9628-45ef-a97b-ff18624f14a0', listeners=649622, playcount=33626641, bio_summary='65daysofstatic began in Sheffield, United Kingdom in 2001 as Iain Armstrong, Paul Wolinski and Joe Shrewsbury. They originally formed to try to write music to fit the deleted 1983 John Carpenter film, 'Stealth Bomber' (starring Kurt Russell) after Joe watched a bootleg of it missing the sound. 65daysofstatic (also known by the abbreviation 65dos or 65days) are an instrumental electronic and post-rock band from Sheffield, UK. Their debut album, The Fall of Math (2004), was released to critical acclaim. Read more on Last.fm', bio_content='65daysofstatic began in Sheffield, United Kingdom in 2001 as Iain Armstrong, Paul Wolinski and Joe Shrewsbury. They originally formed to try to write music to fit the deleted 1983 John Carpenter film, 'Stealth Bomber' (starring Kurt Russell) after Joe watched a bootleg of it missing the sound. 65daysofstatic (also known by the abbreviation 65dos or 65days) are an instrumental electronic and post-rock band from Sheffield, UK. Their debut album, The Fall of Math (2004), was released to critical acclaim. The band intersperses heavy, progressive, guitar-driven instrumental sections with both IDM-esque programmed and live drums. Their albums, as a result, maintain a distinctively gritty, almost industrial feel. Armstrong left in May 2003, Feedle (Graham Clarke) then joined for a brief period and played a part in writing the band's first single from The Fall of Math, Retreat! Retreat!. By the end of 2003 Rob Jones (drums) and Gareth Hughes (bass) had been recruited, increasing the band to four members. Gareth left around the time of the release of their debut album, The Fall of Math, to be replaced by Simon Wright. The second album, One Time For All Time (2005), had a discreet success. In the same year they remixed Burn from the album Crimson by Alkaline Trio. The track appears on one 7inch vinyl out of a set of 2. The third LP, The Destruction of Small Ideas (2007), was indeed a hit with fans and critics. It was anticipated by the release of its single Don't Go Down To Sorrow. Their live album, Escape From New York, was released on 20th April 2009 and featured two new tracks: No Use Crying Over (Some Techno) and Four Score and (Some Drum 'n' Bass). The fourth LP, We Were Exploding Anyway (2010) was released on 26th April 2010. It was anticipated by the release, in Japan only, of a single from the album entitled Weak4. The fifth studio album, Wild Light (2013) was released on Sept 16, 2013 in Europe and Oct 29, 2013 in the US. The 8-track album was released on the Superball Music label. 2016 - Soundtrack for "No Man's Sky" video game The band provided the soundtrack to the much anticipated 2016 video game "No Man's Sky". The trailer for the game was shown at E3 in 2014, which featured the band's "Debutante" track. The band has since composed the entire soundtrack and created a "No Man's Sky" album. Following the experience of writing generative, "infinite" music for No Man's Sky, the band scrapped an album that sounded like their older work and took an experimental audiovisual show Decomposition Theory on tour in 2017, curating live results of playing instruments into algorithmic software that manipulated the sounds in unexpected ways. “We’re trying to remember to look back at the show from the perspective of the audience and make this more than purely self-indulgent or just improvisation,” commented Paul. “All of this can exist in an elastic, liquid timing, but it’s always going to hit certain moments that bring it all back together.” The recorded and unique shows were not released officially but were circulated as bootlegs within the 65dos community. 2019 - A Year of Wreckage and replicr, 2019 On May 1st of 2019, the band began a yearlong musical project entitled "Unreleased/Unreleasable Vol. 4 - A Year of Wreckage". New material is released monthly via the band’s own Bandcamp subscription service. It is described by the band on their website as "an archive of primordial 65 sound palettes, a catalog of (computer) errors and guitar glitches, drone ambience and breakcore math insanity, bleak strategies and escape tunnels". With each new release to subscribers, the previous one will become available as a standalone E.P on the band's Bandcamp page. The band released their seventh (or eighth) official studio album replicr, 2019 in October. The Year of Wreckage project concluded with the April 1 2020 release of the Endings EP and a special 60 minute coronavirus pandemic remix of Safe Passage. Read more on Last.fm. theaudiodb.biography_en:
65daysofstatic (also known by the abbreviations 65dos, 65days, or simply 65) are an instrumental post-rock and math rock band from Sheffield, England comprising Paul Wolinski, Joe Shrewsbury, Rob Jones and Simon Wright. The band has released five studio albums: The Fall of Math, One Time for All Time, The Destruction of Small Ideas, We Were Exploding Anyway, and Silent Running.

Initially, the band interspersed heavy, progressive, guitar-driven instrumental sections with live drums and off-beat sampled drums akin to those of Aphex Twin, although since their second album they have developed their work to include keyboard parts.
theaudiodb.biography_fr:
65daysofstatic, aussi appelé 65days ou 65 dos, est un groupe de musique post-rock instrumental originaire de Sheffield, Royaume-Uni. 

Fondé en 2001 sous la forme d’un trio, alors constitué de Joe Shrewsbury, Paul Wolinski, et de Iain Armstrong, 65daysofstatic tirerait son nom d'un projet de film de John Carpenter, "Stealth Bomber", mettant en vedette Kurt Russell.
La formation du groupe a beaucoup changé depuis sa création en 2001. Armstrong est parti en 2003 pour former un autre groupe, Actionier. Feedle rejoint 65daysofstatic pour une courte période, et l'aide à écrire son premier single, Retreat! Retreat!. Fin 2003, le groupe recrute Rob Jones en tant que batteur et Gareth Hugues à la basse. Ce dernier quitte le groupe au moment de la sortie de son premier album, The Fall of Math, laissant sa place de bassiste à Simon Wright. Des membres d'autres formations, en particulier The Mirimar Disaster ou Youthmovies, les ont en outre souvent accompagnés lors de différents concerts.
Entre Aphex Twin, Roni Size et Mogwai, les Anglais de 65daysofstatic n’ont pas choisi leur camp. Guitares saturées, drum’n bass affolée, electro frénétique, l’expérience sensorielle unique ne laisse personne indemne.
theaudiodb.biography_ru:
65daysofstatic — группа, чья индивидуальность столь же очевидна сколь и бесспорность того, что назвать их музыку каким-то определённым стилем не представляется возможным. Трудно сказать, какой другой музыкальный коллектив так умело сочетает в своём творчестве невероятное количество разных эффектов, так ловко интегрирует электронные сэмплы в живую музыку и так ненавязчиво использует различные музыкальные размеры и ломаные ритмы. Итог их деятельности не вынуждает нас внимать привычным мат-роковым извращениям и заунывным гитарным партиям классического пост-рока по отдельности. Речь идёт о целостном музыкальном продукте, слушая который невозможно не восторгаться идиллией множества авторских идей в едином целом.

По словам Пола Волински (Paul Wolinski), заведующего электронной составляющей коллектива, идея образовать группу к нему пришла задолго до знакомства с её будущими участниками. И лишь после встречи с басистом Яном Армстронгом (Iain Armstrong) и гитаристом Джо-Фро (Joe-Fro) в 2001 году его нечёткая мысль начала приобретать свои очертания. Через четыре недели после знакомства ребята отыграли свой первый концерт; однако, следующие два года музыканты просуществовали как трио, не достигшее особых высот.

Результатами постоянных репетиций стали многочисленные наброски и демо-записи, а также работа над саундтреком так и невышедшего в широкий прокат малобюджетного фильма режиссера Джона Карпентера (John Carpenter) «Stealth Bomber», в основе которого лежал сюжет о жизни землян в период глобальной информационной катастрофы, выведшей из строя все коммуникации планеты на 65 дней. ‘65 дней тишины’ или при дословном переводе «65 дней радио помех» — в этом и есть смысл названия группы.

«Честно говоря, у нас не было никаких возможностей издавать нашу музыку. Всё что мы делали в течение долгого времени, казалось, не имело абсолютно никаких результатов и перспектив. У каждого из нас была работа, чтобы хоть как-то оплачивать аренду нашей маленькой студии, в которой мы проводили всё свободное время, и которая стала для нас вторым домом. Это было жутким испытанием, и мы теряли веру в то, что когда-нибудь что-то изменится», — признаётся Пол. В мае 2003 года группу покидает Ян Армстронг, и 65daysofstatic находятся на грани распада.

К концу 2003 года к музыкантам присоединяется очередной басист Гарет (Gareth), и у 65daysofstatic появляется возможность приступить к записи своего дебютного Stumble.Stop.Repeat EP. В период завершения работы над пластинкой на собственном подпольном лейбле группы, Джо случайно сталкивается со старым приятелем по колледжу Робом Джонсом (Rob Jones), который входит в состав в качестве ударника. Так, количество участников увеличивается до четырёх человек.

Stumble.Stop.Repeat EP (2003, Dustpunk Records) штампуется в количестве 1000 экземпляров и тут же распродаётся. К группе появляется интерес со стороны прессы, начинают поступать интересные предложения. В феврале 2004 года 65daysofstatic отправляется в свой первый тур по родной Англии с оксфордскими Youthmovie Soundtrack Strategies.
«Мы были счастливы хотя бы на время уехать из Шеффилда — города, который всегда был безразличен к нестандартной музыке; где группам, играющим на одной сцене, откровенно наплевать друг на друга; где никогда ничего не меняется», — вспоминает Джо. «Вот почему я играю в 65daysofstatic. Потому что мы можем собрать инструменты, сесть в автобус и вернуться сюда только к Рождеству».

Помимо всего прочего, одной из главных задач музыкантов на тот момент были деньги, которые бы позволили группе вернуться в студию и продолжить уже начатую работу над следующей пластинкой. На этот раз материала набирается на полноценный альбом из одиннадцати треков, релиз которого запланирован на осень 2004 года. К этому времени из 65daysofstatic уходит басист и его место занимает новичок Саймон Райт (Simon Wright), окончательно подведя черту под изменениями в составе группы.

The Fall Of Math (2004, Monotreme Records) критики встретили с восторгом. Эту пластинку называли «саундтреком иного измерения, где рок и электроника равны». Следом за ней ограниченным тиражом изданы синглы Retreat! Retreat! (ноябрь 2004) и Hole EP (март 2005) с би-сайдами альбома и клипами группы. Тяжёлые гитарные партии, живые барабаны и синкопические электронные сэмплы ударных до краёв наполнили музыку 65daysofstatic индустриальной атмосферой, что делает их шоу просто незабываемыми.

В перерывах между изнуряющими турами по всей Европе 65daysofstatic, привыкшие к работе в полевых условиях, собирают материал для нового лонг-плея One Time For All Times, увидевшего свет в октябре 2005 года, и опять же удостоившегося высоких оценок слушателей и обозревателей. Их последующий сингл Radio Protector (февраль 2006), выпущенный исключительно на виниле, содержит в себе би-сайд ‘Asphalt & Trouble’, в котором использован сэмпл знаменитой в своё время игры Full Throttle.
theaudiodb.name: 65daysofstatic

discogs.profile: Sheffield (UK) based math/post rock band founded in 2001 by Joe Shrewsbury (also known as [a=JoeFro]), [a=Paul Wolinski] and [a=Iain Armstrong]. In May 2003 [a=Iain Armstrong] left the band. [a=Graham Clarke] (also known as [a=Feedle]) joined for a short moment in 2003 and in the end of 2003 [a=Rob Jones (2)] and [a=Gareth Hughes] joined the band. Around September 2004 [a=Gareth Hughes] left the band again and [a=Simon Wright (3)] took over.

raw_data.name: 65daysofstatic
raw_data.profile: Sheffield (UK) based math/post rock band founded in 2001 by Joe Shrewsbury (also known as [a=JoeFro]), [a=Paul Wolinski] and [a=Iain Armstrong]. In May 2003 [a=Iain Armstrong] left the band. [a=Graham Clarke] (also known as [a=Feedle]) joined for a short moment in 2003 and in the end of 2003 [a=Rob Jones (2)] and [a=Gareth Hughes] joined the band. Around September 2004 [a=Gareth Hughes] left the band again and [a=Simon Wright (3)] took over.

lastfm.bio_content: 65daysofstatic began in Sheffield, United Kingdom in 2001 as Iain Armstrong, Paul Wolinski and Joe Shrewsbury. They originally formed to try to write music to fit the deleted 1983 John Carpenter film, 'Stealth Bomber' (starring Kurt Russell) after Joe watched a bootleg of it missing the sound. 65daysofstatic (also known by the abbreviation 65dos or 65days) are an instrumental electronic and post-rock band from Sheffield, UK. Their debut album, The Fall of Math (2004), was released to critical acclaim. The band intersperses heavy, progressive, guitar-driven instrumental sections with both IDM-esque programmed and live drums. Their albums, as a result, maintain a distinctively gritty, almost industrial feel. Armstrong left in May 2003, Feedle (Graham Clarke) then joined for a brief period and played a part in writing the band's first single from The Fall of Math, Retreat! Retreat!. By the end of 2003 Rob Jones (drums) and Gareth Hughes (bass) had been recruited, increasing the band to four members. Gareth left around the time of the release of their debut album, The Fall of Math, to be replaced by Simon Wright. The second album, One Time For All Time (2005), had a discreet success. In the same year they remixed Burn from the album Crimson by Alkaline Trio. The track appears on one 7inch vinyl out of a set of 2. The third LP, The Destruction of Small Ideas (2007), was indeed a hit with fans and critics. It was anticipated by the release of its single Don't Go Down To Sorrow. Their live album, Escape From New York, was released on 20th April 2009 and featured two new tracks: No Use Crying Over (Some Techno) and Four Score and (Some Drum 'n' Bass). The fourth LP, We Were Exploding Anyway (2010) was released on 26th April 2010. It was anticipated by the release, in Japan only, of a single from the album entitled Weak4. The fifth studio album, Wild Light (2013) was released on Sept 16, 2013 in Europe and Oct 29, 2013 in the US. The 8-track album was released on the Superball Music label. 2016 - Soundtrack for "No Man's Sky" video game The band provided the soundtrack to the much anticipated 2016 video game "No Man's Sky". The trailer for the game was shown at E3 in 2014, which featured the band's "Debutante" track. The band has since composed the entire soundtrack and created a "No Man's Sky" album. Following the experience of writing generative, "infinite" music for No Man's Sky, the band scrapped an album that sounded like their older work and took an experimental audiovisual show Decomposition Theory on tour in 2017, curating live results of playing instruments into algorithmic software that manipulated the sounds in unexpected ways. “We’re trying to remember to look back at the show from the perspective of the audience and make this more than purely self-indulgent or just improvisation,” commented Paul. “All of this can exist in an elastic, liquid timing, but it’s always going to hit certain moments that bring it all back together.” The recorded and unique shows were not released officially but were circulated as bootlegs within the 65dos community. 2019 - A Year of Wreckage and replicr, 2019 On May 1st of 2019, the band began a yearlong musical project entitled "Unreleased/Unreleasable Vol. 4 - A Year of Wreckage". New material is released monthly via the band’s own Bandcamp subscription service. It is described by the band on their website as "an archive of primordial 65 sound palettes, a catalog of (computer) errors and guitar glitches, drone ambience and breakcore math insanity, bleak strategies and escape tunnels". With each new release to subscribers, the previous one will become available as a standalone E.P on the band's Bandcamp page. The band released their seventh (or eighth) official studio album replicr, 2019 in October. The Year of Wreckage project concluded with the April 1 2020 release of the Endings EP and a special 60 minute coronavirus pandemic remix of Safe Passage. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.

They originally formed to try to write music to fit the deleted 1983 John Carpenter film, 'Stealth Bomber' (starring Kurt Russell) after Joe watched a bootleg of it missing the sound. 65daysofstatic (also known by the abbreviation 65dos or 65days) are an instrumental electronic and post-rock band from Sheffield, UK. Their debut album, The Fall of Math (2004), was released to critical acclaim. Read more on Last.fm

theaudiodb.biography_en:
65daysofstatic (also known by the abbreviations 65dos, 65days, or simply 65) are an instrumental post-rock and math rock band from Sheffield, England comprising Paul Wolinski, Joe Shrewsbury, Rob Jones and Simon Wright. The band has released five studio albums: The Fall of Math, One Time for All Time, The Destruction of Small Ideas, We Were Exploding Anyway, and Silent Running.

Initially, the band interspersed heavy, progressive, guitar-driven instrumental sections with live drums and off-beat sampled drums akin to those of Aphex Twin, although since their second album they have developed their work to include keyboard parts.
theaudiodb.biography_fr:
65daysofstatic, aussi appelé 65days ou 65 dos, est un groupe de musique post-rock instrumental originaire de Sheffield, Royaume-Uni. 

Fondé en 2001 sous la forme d’un trio, alors constitué de Joe Shrewsbury, Paul Wolinski, et de Iain Armstrong, 65daysofstatic tirerait son nom d'un projet de film de John Carpenter, "Stealth Bomber", mettant en vedette Kurt Russell.
La formation du groupe a beaucoup changé depuis sa création en 2001. Armstrong est parti en 2003 pour former un autre groupe, Actionier. Feedle rejoint 65daysofstatic pour une courte période, et l'aide à écrire son premier single, Retreat! Retreat!. Fin 2003, le groupe recrute Rob Jones en tant que batteur et Gareth Hugues à la basse. Ce dernier quitte le groupe au moment de la sortie de son premier album, The Fall of Math, laissant sa place de bassiste à Simon Wright. Des membres d'autres formations, en particulier The Mirimar Disaster ou Youthmovies, les ont en outre souvent accompagnés lors de différents concerts.
Entre Aphex Twin, Roni Size et Mogwai, les Anglais de 65daysofstatic n’ont pas choisi leur camp. Guitares saturées, drum’n bass affolée, electro frénétique, l’expérience sensorielle unique ne laisse personne indemne.
